name: df-slmd
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, setvar s8, setvar s9, setvar s10, setvar s11
body: |- wceq(cslmd, crab(s0, ccmn, wsbc(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(cplusg, cv(s0)), wsbc(s3, cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), wsbc(s4, cfv(csca, cv(s0)), wsbc(s5, cfv(cbs, cv(s4)), wsbc(s6, cfv(cplusg, cv(s4)), wsbc(s7, cfv(cmulr, cv(s4)), wa(wcel(cv(s4), csrg), wral(s8, cv(s5), wral(s9, cv(s5), wral(s10, cv(s1), wral(s11, cv(s1), wa(w3a(wcel(co(cv(s9), cv(s3), cv(s11)), cv(s1)), wceq(co(cv(s9), cv(s3), co(cv(s11), cv(s2), cv(s10))), co(co(cv(s9), cv(s3), cv(s11)), cv(s2), co(cv(s9), cv(s3), cv(s10)))), wceq(co(co(cv(s8), cv(s6), cv(s9)), cv(s3), cv(s11)), co(co(cv(s8), cv(s3), cv(s11)), cv(s2), co(cv(s9), cv(s3), cv(s11))))), w3a(wceq(co(co(cv(s8), cv(s7), cv(s9)), cv(s3), cv(s11)), co(cv(s8), cv(s3), co(cv(s9), cv(s3), cv(s11)))), wceq(co(cfv(cur, cv(s4)), cv(s3), cv(s11)), cv(s11)), wceq(co(cfv(c0g, cv(s4)), cv(s3), cv(s11)), cfv(c0g, cv(s0)))))))))))))))))))
comment: Define the class of all (left) modules over semirings, i.e. semimodules, which are generalizations of left modules. A semimodule is a commutative monoid (=vectors) together with a semiring (=scalars) and a left scalar product connecting them. ` ( 0 [,] +oo ) ` for example is not a full fledged left module, but is a semimodule. Definition of [Golan] p. 149. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 21-Mar-2018.)
